wikipedia_page.main: Eustace Lycett (December 21, 1914 – November 16, 2006) was a British special effects artist who worked on attractions at Disneyland from the 1960s, such as Great Moments with Mr. Lincoln and Rocket to the Moon, as well as contributing to Disney animation.

The special effects were created by Robert A. Mattey and Eustace Lycett, who were nominated for an Academy Award, and included the sodium screen matte process, as well as miniatures and wire-supported mockups.  The film's "Medfield Fight Song" was written by Richard M. and Robert B. Sherman, their first song for a Disney feature.
*Bedknobs and Broomsticks – Danny Lee, Eustace Lycett and Alan Maley
**The Black Hole – Peter Ellenshaw, Art Cruickshank, Eustace Lycett, Danny Lee, Harrison Ellenshaw and Joe Hale
* Mary Poppins – Peter Ellenshaw, Eustace Lycett and Hamilton Luske
** The Absent-Minded Professor – Visual Effects by Robert A. Mattey and Eustace Lycett
